001package imagingbook.lib.image.data;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004
005import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
006import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
007import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
008import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
009import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
010import imagingbook.lib.color.RgbUtils;
011import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.lib.image.access.GridIndexer2D;
013import imagingbook.lib.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
014
015/**
016 * This class defines a generic data container for scalar and
017 * vector-valued images, using float-values throughout.
018 * Its primary use is in the {@link GenericFilter} framework. 
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2021/01/14
022 */
023public class PixelPack {
024        
025        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
026        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
027
028        private final int depth;
029        private final float[][] data;
030        private final int length;
031        private final GridIndexer2D indexer;
032        
033        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
034        
035        /**
036         * Constructor. Creates a blank (zero-valued) pack of pixel data.
037         * @param width the image width
038         * @param height the image height
039         * @param depth the number of channels (slices)
040         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
041         */
042        public PixelPack(int width, int height, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
043                this.depth = depth;
044                this.length = width * height;
045                this.data = new float[depth][length];
046                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, obs);
047        }
048        
049        /**
050         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
051         * {@link ImageProcessor} object. Uses
052         * {@link #DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy} as the out-of-bounds strategy
053         * (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}).
054         * @param ip the source image
055         */
056        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip) {
057                this(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy);
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
062         * {@link ImageProcessor} object, using the specified out-of-bounds strategy.
063         * @param ip the source image
064         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
065         */
066        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
067                this(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight(), ip.getNChannels(), obs);
068                copyFromImageProcessor(ip, this);
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack} without copying 
073         * the contained pixel data.
074         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
075         */
076        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig) {
077                this(orig, false);
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack}, optionally copying 
082         * the contained pixel data.
083         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
084         * @param copyData set true to copy pixel data
085         */
086        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig, boolean copyData) {
087                this(orig.getWidth(), orig.getHeight(), orig.getDepth(), orig.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy());
088                if (copyData) {
089                        orig.copyTo(this);
090                }
091        }
092        
093        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
094
095        /**
096         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a float-vector.
097         * If the supplied array is non-null, it is filled in and returned,
098         * otherwise a new array is returned.
099         * The length of this array corresponds to the number of slices in this
100         * pixel pack.
101         * The values returned at out-of-bounds positions depends on this
102         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
103         * 
104         * @param u the x-position
105         * @param v the y-position
106         * @param vals a suitable 
107         * @return the array of pixel data
108         */
109        public float[] getVec(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
110                if (vals == null) 
111                        vals = new float[depth];
112                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
113                if (i < 0) {    // i = -1 --> default value (zero)
114                        Arrays.fill(vals, 0);
115                }
116                else {  
117                        for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
118                                vals[k] = data[k][i];
119                        }
120                }
121                return vals;
122        }
123        
124        // returns a new pixel array
125        public float[] getVec(int u, int v) {
126                return getVec(u, v, new float[depth]);
127        }
128        
129        /**
130         * Sets the pixel data at the specified pixel position.
131         * The length of the value array corresponds to the number of slices in this
132         * pixel pack.
133         * @param u the x-position
134         * @param v the y-position
135         * @param vals a float vector with the values for this pixel
136         */
137        public void setVec(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
138                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
139                if (i >= 0) {
140                        for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
141                                data[k][i] = vals[k];
142                        }
143                }
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Copies the contents of one pixel pack to another.
148         * The involved pixel packs must have the same dimensions.
149         * @param other another pixel pack
150         */
151        public void copyTo(PixelPack other) {
152                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(other)) {
153                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("pixel packs of incompatible size, cannot copy");
154                }
155                for (int k = 0; k < this.depth; k++) {
156                        System.arraycopy(this.data[k], 0, other.data[k], 0, this.length);
157                }
158        }
159        
160        /**
161         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as another
162         * pixel pack, i.e., can be copied to it.
163         * @param other the other pixel pack
164         * @return true if both have the same dimensions
165         */
166        public boolean isCompatibleTo(PixelPack other) {
167                if (this.data.length == other.data.length && this.length == other.length) { // TODO: check width/height too
168                        return true;
169                }
170                else
171                        return false;
172        }
173        
174        /**
175         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as the
176         * specified {@link ImageProcessor} instance, i.e., can be copied to it.
177         * @param ip the image processor instance
178         * @return true if compatible
179         */
180        public boolean isCompatibleTo(ImageProcessor ip) {
181                if (this.getWidth() != ip.getWidth() || this.getHeight() != ip.getHeight()) {
182                        return false;
183                }
184                if (this.getDepth() != ip.getNChannels()) {
185                        return false;
186                }
187                return true;
188        }
189        
190        /**
191         * Returns a reference to the specified {@link PixelSlice}.
192         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
193         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
194         * @return a reference to the pixel slice
195         */
196        public PixelSlice getSlice(int k) throws IllegalArgumentException {
197                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
198                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal slice number " + k);
199                }
200                return new PixelSlice(k);
201        }
202        
203        /**
204         * Creates and returns a new {@link PixelSlice} with the same dimensions
205         * and out-of-bounds strategy as this {@link PixelPack}.
206         * @return a new pixel slice
207         */
208        public PixelSlice getEmptySlice() {
209                return new PixelSlice();
210        }
211        
212        /**
213         * Returns a reference to this {@link PixelPack}'s internal data
214         * array, which is always two-dimensional:
215         * dimension 1 is the slice index,
216         * dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).
217         * @return the pixel pack's data array
218         */
219        public float[][] getArrays() {
220                return data;
221        }
222        
223        /**
224         * Returns the width of the associated image.
225         * @return the image width
226         */
227        public int getWidth() {
228                return this.indexer.getWidth();
229        }
230        
231        /**
232         * Returns the height of the associated image.
233         * @return the image height
234         */
235        public int getHeight() {
236                return this.indexer.getHeight();
237        }
238        
239        /**
240         * Returns the depth (number of slices) of the associated image.
241         * @return the image depth
242         */
243        public int getDepth() {
244                return this.depth;
245        }
246        
247        /**
248         * Returns the out-of-bounds strategy.
249         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
250         */
251        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
252                return this.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy();
253        }
254
255        /**
256         * Sets all values of this pixel pack to zero.
257         */
258        public void zero() {
259                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
260                        getSlice(k).zero();
261                }
262        }
263        
264        /**
265         * Returns the pixel values in the 3x3 neighborhood around the
266         * specified position.
267         * The returned float-array has the structure {@code [x][y][k]},
268         * with x,y = 0,...,2  and k is the slice index.
269         * 
270         * @param uc the center x-position
271         * @param vc the center x-position
272         * @param nh a float array to be filled in (or null)
273         * @return the neighborhood array
274         */
275        public float[][][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][][] nh) {
276                if (nh == null) 
277                        nh = new float[3][3][depth];
278                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
279                        int u = uc - 1 + i;
280                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
281                                int v = vc - 1 + j;
282                                nh[i][j] = getVec(u, v);
283                        }
284                }
285                return nh;
286        }
287        
288        /**
289         * Copies the contents of this pixel pack to the supplied {@link ImageProcessor}
290         * instance, if compatible. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
291         * 
292         * @param ip the target image processor
293         */
294        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
295                copyToImageProcessor(this, ip);
296        }
297        
298        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
299        
300        /**
301         * Inner class representing a single (scalar-valued) pixel slice of a 
302         * (vector-valued) {@link PixelPack}.
303         *
304         */
305        public class PixelSlice {
306                private final int idx;
307                private final float[] vals;
308                
309                /**
310                 * Constructor. Creates a pixel slice for the specified component.
311                 * @param idx the slice (component) index
312                 */
313                PixelSlice(int idx) {
314                        this.idx = idx;
315                        this.vals = data[idx];
316                }
317                
318                /** Constructor. Creates an empty (zero-valued) pixel slice with the same
319                 * properties as the containing pixel pack but not associated
320                 * with it.
321                 */
322                PixelSlice() {
323                        this.idx = -1;
324                        this.vals = new float[length];
325                }
326                
327                /**
328                 * Returns the pixel value for the specified image position.
329                 * @param u the x-position
330                 * @param v the y-position
331                 * @return the slice value
332                 */
333                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
334                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
335                        return (i >= 0) ? vals[i] : 0;
336                }
337                
338                /**
339                 * Sets the pixel value at the specified image position.
340                 * @param u the x-position
341                 * @param v the y-position
342                 * @param val the new value
343                 */
344                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
345                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
346                        if (i >= 0) {
347                                vals[i] = val;
348                        }
349                }
350                
351                /**
352                 * Returns the slice index for this pixel slice, i.e, the
353                 * component number in the containing pixel pack.
354                 * -1 is returned if the pixel slice is not associated with
355                 * a pixel pack.
356                 * @return the slice index
357                 */
358                public int getIndex() {
359                        return idx;
360                }
361                
362                /** 
363                 * Returns a reference to the data array associated with this pixel slice.
364                 * @return the data array
365                 */
366                public float[] getArray() {
367                        return vals;
368                }
369                
370                /**
371                 * Returns the length (number of pixels) of the associated 1D pixel array.
372                 * @return the length of the image array
373                 */
374                public int getLength() {
375                        return vals.length;
376                }
377                
378                /**
379                 * Returns the width of the associated image
380                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
381                 * @return the image width
382                 */
383                public int getWidth() {
384                        return PixelPack.this.getWidth();
385                }
386                
387                /**
388                 * Returns the height of the associated image
389                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
390                 * @return the image height
391                 */
392                public int getHeight() {
393                        return PixelPack.this.getHeight();
394                }
395                
396                /**
397                 * Sets all pixel values to zero.
398                 */
399                public void zero() {
400                        Arrays.fill(this.vals, 0);
401                }
402                
403                /**
404                 * Copies the contents of this pixel slice to another
405                 * pixel slice.
406                 * @param other the pixel slice to modified
407                 */
408                public void copyTo(PixelSlice other) {
409                        System.arraycopy(this.vals, 0, other.vals, 0, this.vals.length);
410                }
411                
412                /**
413                 * Returns the pixel values from the 3x3 neighborhood centered at
414                 * the specified position.
415                 * The 3x3 array {@code nh[x][y]} has the coordinates
416                 * x = 0,..,2 and y = 0,..,2; 
417                 * the value at position {@code [1][1]} belongs to the 
418                 * specified position.
419                 * If a non-null array is supplied, it is filled and returned.
420                 * If null, a new array is created and returned.
421                 * 
422                 * @param uc the center x-position
423                 * @param vc the center y-position
424                 * @param nh a 3x3 array or null
425                 * @return a 3x3 array of pixel values
426                 */
427                public float[][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][] nh) {
428                        if (nh == null) 
429                                nh = new float[3][3];
430                        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
431                                int u = uc - 1 + i;
432                                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
433                                        int v = vc - 1 + j;
434                                        nh[i][j] = getVal(u, v);
435                                }
436                        }
437                        return nh;
438                }
439        }
440        
441        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
442
443        /**
444         * Utility method. Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing
445         * pixel pack. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
446         * 
447         * @param ip the image processor to be copied
448         * @param pack the receiving pixel pack
449         */
450        public static void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
451                if (!pack.isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
452                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyFromImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
453                }
454                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
455                        copyFromByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip, pack);
456                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
457                        copyFromShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip, pack);
458                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
459                        copyFromFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip, pack);
460                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
461                        copyFromColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip, pack);
462                else 
463                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
464        }
465        
466        private static void copyFromByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
467                final float[][] P = pack.data;
468                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
469                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
470                        P[0][i] = 0xff & pixels[i];
471                }
472        }
473        
474        private static void copyFromShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
475                final float[][] P = pack.data;
476                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
477                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
478                        P[0][i] = 0xffff & pixels[i];
479                }
480        }
481        
482        private static void copyFromFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
483                final float[][] P = pack.data;
484                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
485                System.arraycopy(pixels, 0, P[0], 0, pixels.length);
486        }
487        
488        private static void copyFromColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
489                final float[][] P = pack.data;
490                final int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
491                final int[] rgb = new int[3];
492                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
493                        RgbUtils.intToRgb(pixels[i], rgb);
494                        P[0][i] = rgb[0];
495                        P[1][i] = rgb[1];
496                        P[2][i] = rgb[2];
497                }
498        }
499        
500        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
501        
502        /**
503         * Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing
504         * image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
505         * 
506         * @param pack the source pixel pack
507         * @param ip the receiving image processor
508         */
509        public static void copyToImageProcessor(PixelPack pack, ImageProcessor ip) {
510                if (!pack.isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
511                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyToImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
512                }
513                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
514                        copyToByteProcessor(pack, (ByteProcessor)ip);
515                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
516                        copyToShortProcessor(pack, (ShortProcessor)ip);
517                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
518                        copyToFloatProcessor(pack, (FloatProcessor)ip);
519                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
520                        copyToColorProcessor(pack, (ColorProcessor)ip);
521                else
522                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
523        }
524        
525        private static void copyToByteProcessor(PixelPack pack, ByteProcessor ip) {
526                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
527                float[] P = pack.data[0];
528                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
529                        int val = clampByte(Math.round(P[i]));
530                        pixels[i] = (byte) val;
531                }
532        }
533        
534        private static void copyToShortProcessor(PixelPack pack, ShortProcessor ip) {
535                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
536                float[] P = pack.data[0];
537                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
538                        int val = clampShort(Math.round(P[i]));
539                        pixels[i] = (short) val;
540                }
541        }
542        
543        private static void copyToFloatProcessor(PixelPack pack, FloatProcessor ip) {
544                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
545                float[] P = pack.data[0];
546                System.arraycopy(P, 0, pixels, 0, P.length);
547        }
548        
549        private static void copyToColorProcessor(PixelPack pack, ColorProcessor ip) {
550                int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
551                float[] R = pack.data[0];
552                float[] G = pack.data[1];
553                float[] B = pack.data[2];
554                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
555                        int r = clampByte(Math.round(R[i]));
556                        int g = clampByte(Math.round(G[i]));
557                        int b = clampByte(Math.round(B[i]));
558                        pixels[i] = RgbUtils.rgbToInt(r, g, b);
559                }
560        }
561        
562        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
563        
564        private static int clampByte(int val) {
565                if (val < 0) return 0;
566                if (val > 255) return 255;
567                return val;
568        }
569        
570        private static int clampShort(int val) {
571                if (val < 0) return 0;
572                if (val > 65535) return 65535;
573                return val;
574        }
575
576}
